description: A large, all-white cockatoo known for its large, expressive crest that opens up like an umbrella. They are one of the most popular and affectionate large cockatoos.
temperament: The quintessential 'velcro bird.' They are incredibly affectionate, cuddly, and gentle, but this comes with a high price: they are extremely demanding of attention and can be prone to separation anxiety.
loudness: Extremely Loud. Their screech is incredibly powerful and they will use it to demand attention or express excitement or fear.
vocalization: Can learn a fair number of words, but are more known for their loud screams and playful chattering.
dietaryNeeds: A high-quality pelleted diet, lots of fresh vegetables, and limited fruits and nuts to prevent weight gain.
healthPointers: Can live 60-80+ years. Extremely prone to feather plucking and self-mutilation if their social needs are not met. They also produce a large amount of powder down.
housing: Not suitable for apartments. Requires a large, durable cage with plenty of toys. Minimum 40"W x 30"D x 60"H.
